biogHist.p: Born and raised in Brampton, Ontario, Stephen Heatley moved to Edmonton in 1977. His theatre training includes a Bachelor of Arts Degree in Dama and English from Brock University in St. Catharines, a six-month stint at the Canadian Mime School, and a Masters of Fine Arts in Directing from the University of Alberta. He was appointed Artistic Director of Edmonton's Theatre Network in 1981 and at there he directed over 25 productions of new plays. He has occasionally taken on acting and writing duties. Mr. Heatley helped to found and teach in Network's "Explorations in Theatre" programme and spent several seasons as a Theatresports coach. He has also directed for Alberta Theatre Projects in Calgary, Chinook Theatre, Catalyst Theatre and Workshop West Theatre in Edmonton, the Bastion Theatre in Victoria, and the Blyth Festival in Ontario. During the summer of 1990, he directed a highly successful production of Twelfth Night at Saskatoon's "Shakespeare on the Saskatchewan" Festival. Mr. Heatley has also lectured at the University of Alberta in the Drama Department. For nine summers, he taught Drama workshops and adjudicated Drama Festivals around Alberta. He taught at Alberta Culture's Summer Drama Schools in Drumheller, Fairview, Vermilion and Edmonton. Stephen Heatley is the co-author of the published play, The Other Side of the Pole with Marney Heatley and Edward Connell. Mr. Heatley is currently an Associate Professor in the University of British Columbia's Drama Department.
